sentence.Network_en: Hotels operate a collection service for their guests from the airports.
sentence.Network_cn: 宾馆为客人提供机场接机服务。

sentence.Network_en: Chris likes music and has a large collection of albums and cassettes.
sentence.Network_cn: 克里斯喜欢音乐，收集了大量的唱片和磁带。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin collectio(n-), from colligere 'gather together' (see collect)

entry.def: A collection of things is a group of similar things that you have deliberately acquired, usually over a period of time.

example.ex: Robert's collection of prints and paintings has been bought over the years...
example.tran: 这些年来，罗伯特逐渐收藏了一批版画和绘画作品。

example.ex: The Art Gallery of Ontario has the world's largest collection of sculptures by Henry Moore...
example.tran: 安大略美术馆是世界上收藏亨利·摩尔雕塑作品最多的美术馆。

entry.tran: (故事、诗歌或文章的)集子，作品集
entry.def: A collection of stories, poems, or articles is a number of them published in one book.

example.ex: Two years ago he published a collection of short stories called 'Facing The Music'...
example.tran: 两年前，他出版了短篇小说集《勇敢面对》。

example.ex: The Brookings Institution has assembled a collection of essays from foreign affairs experts.
example.tran: 布鲁金斯研究所将一批外交专家撰写的文章结集出版。

entry.def: A collection of things is a group of things.

example.ex: Wye Lea is a collection of farm buildings that have been converted into an attractive complex.
example.tran: “怀河草地”是一处由农舍改造而成的赏心悦目的建筑群。

entry.def: A fashion designer's new collection consists of the new clothes they have designed for the next season.
Collection is the act of collecting something from a place or from people.

example.ex: Money can be sent to any one of 22,000 agents worldwide for collection.
example.tran: 可以把钱汇给分布在世界各地的22,000名筹款代理人中的任何一位。

example.ex: ...computer systems to speed up collection of information.
example.tran: 加速信息收集的计算机系统

entry.def: If you organize a collection for charity, you collect money from people to give to charity.

example.ex: I asked my headmaster if he could arrange a collection for a refugee charity.
example.tran: 我问校长他是否能为救济难民的慈善机构组织一次募捐。

entry.def: A collection is money that is given by people in church during some Christian services.

means.word_mean: 1. several things grouped together or considered as a whole
2. a publication containing a variety of works
3. request for a sum of money;

sentences.sentence: "an appeal to raise money for starving children"

means.word_mean: 4. the act of gathering something together

stems_affixes.word_buile: collect[v.收集]+ive……的→adj.集体的,共同的 n.集体

stems_affixes.value_cn: 智力的,理智的,有理解力的
stems_affixes.word_buile: intellect[n.理智,智力,才智]+ual……的→n.知识分子 adj.智力的,理智的,有理解力的
collect[v.收集]+ion表名词→n.收藏[品],收集[物]
collect[v.收集]+ive……的→adj.集体的,共同的 n.集体
elect[v.选举,推选;选择,作出选择]+ion表名词→n.选举,选择权;当选

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有选举权的人,选举人,竞选人
stems_affixes.word_buile: elect[v.选举,推选;选择,作出选择]+or人→n.有选举权的人,选举人,竞选人

stems_affixes.value_cn: [集合名词]精华;精锐;中坚分子;精英
stems_affixes.word_buile: el=elect[v.选举,推选;选择,作出选择]+ite人→选出的人→精英
intel=inter在……中间+lect选择,收集→在中间选出的人→智者
intellect[n.理智,智力,才智]+ual……的→n.知识分子 adj.智力的,理智的,有理解力的
recollect[v.回忆,想起,记起,忆起,记得]+ion表名词→n.回忆
select[v.选出]+ion表名词→n.选择,挑选;选集,精选物
acro高+lect讲,读,说→高层说的话
dia对着+lect讲,读,说→两个对着说→方言
idio个人的+lect说→个人说的话
neg没有+lect选择,收集→没有选出→疏忽
lect讲,读,说+ure表名词→n.&v.演讲,讲课
col共同+lect选择→放在一起选择→收集

stems_affixes.value_cn: 选举,推选;选择,作出选择
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+lect选择,收集→选出

stems_affixes.value_cn: 回忆,想起,记起,忆起,记得
stems_affixes.word_buile: re重新+collect[v.收集]→重新收集[集中]→回想到
se分开+lect选→选出分开

He has a fairly large collection of quality trucks.

sentences.en: Her new book is a collection of short stories.

sentences.en: His workmates made a collection for his leaving party.
sentences.cn: 他的同事为他的告别晚会募捐。

sentences.en: There is a collection of rubbish in the corner.
